entry.label: SDN:L231:6:CDI = Common Data Index record
entry.description: Metadata record providing discovery and evaluation metadata for a SeaDataNet data object

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:CPRD = Composite Product Record
entry.description: Metadata record providing discovery metadata for a product such as a DTM which is provided by a data provider in place of their actual survey data as source for the project.

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:CSR = Cruise Summary record
entry.description: Metadata record describing a cruise that has already taken place

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:EDIOSDS = EDIOS data series record
entry.description: Metadata record describing a data series from the European Directory of the Initial Ocean Observing System

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:EDIOSOP = EDIOS observing programme record
entry.description: Metadata record describing an observing programme from the European Directory of the Initial Ocean Observing System

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:EDIOSPL = EDIOS platform record
entry.description: Metadata record describing a data collection platform from the European Directory of the Initial Ocean Observing System

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:EDMED = EDMED record
entry.description: Metadata record describing a dataset from the European Directory of Marine Environmental Datasets

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:EDMERP = EDMERP project record
entry.description: Metadata record describing a project in the European Directory of Marine Environmental Research Projects

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:IPRD = Intermediate Product record
entry.description: Metadata record providing discovery metadata for a product such as a DTM which is produced following the project methodology for the construction of a final product eg a DTM delivered by partners to a regional integrator.

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:PCR = Planned Cruise record
entry.description: Metadata record describing a cruise that is planned for the future

entry.label: SDN:L231:6:PRODUCT = Product record
entry.description: Metadata record providing discovery metadata for a data product

entry.label: SDN:EDMERP::11805 = EMODNet Chemistry
entry.description: Preparatory action for European Marine Observation and Data Network - Lot 3 - Chemistry

entry.label: SDN:EDMERP::11696 = EMODNet Seabed Mapping
entry.description: Preparatory action for European Marine Observation and Data Network - Seabed Mapping Lot

entry.label: SDN:EDMERP::11451 = EMODNet Biology
entry.description: Preparatory action for European Marine Observation and Data Network - Lot 1 - Biology

entry.label: SDN:EDMERP::11373 = EMODNet Hydrography
entry.description: Preparatory action for European Marine Observation and Data Network - Lot 1 – Hydrography

entry.label: SDN:EDMERP::11344 = Geo-Seas
entry.description: Pan-European infrastructure for management of marine and ocean geological and geophysical data

entry.label: Public
entry.description: Public

entry.label: Confidential
entry.description: Confidential, for project partners

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D23 = Belfast Ordnance Datum
entry.description: Mean sea level at Clarendon Loch, Belfast averaged between 1951 and 1956 used for the elevation of the zero metres contour on Ordnance Survey of Northern Ireland maps.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D06 = Bulgarian Navy Hydrographic Service Chart Datum
entry.code: SDN:L111:7:D06 = Bulgarian Navy Hydrographic Service Chart Datum
entry.description: The elevation of the zero metres contour on the navigation charts produced by the Bulgarian Navy.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D21 = Danish Vertical Reference 1990
entry.description: Danish mean sea level during 1990 introduced in 2001 and adopted as the level of the zero metre contour in Denmark in 2003.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D07 = French Naval Chart Datum
entry.description: The elevation of the zero metres contour on the navigation charts produced by the French Navy.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D30 = French Naval Chart Datum for Lebanon
entry.code: SDN:L111:7:D30 = French Naval Chart Datum for Lebanon
entry.description: The elevation of the zero metres contour on the navigation charts produced by the French Navy for Lebanese coastal waters.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D05 = Hellenic Navy Hydrographic Service Chart Datum
entry.code: SDN:L111:7:D05 = Hellenic Navy Hydrographic Service Chart Datum
entry.description: The elevation of the zero metres contour on the navigation charts produced by the Greek Navy.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D27 = Helsinki Tide Gauge Datum
entry.description: Finnish national benchmark network mean sea level datum.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D02 = Highest Astronomical Tide
entry.description: The highest level expected to be reached by the sea surface after pertubations due to waves have been filtered out under average meteorological conditions and any combination of astronomical conditions.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D01 = Lowest Astronomical Tide
entry.description: The lowest level expected to be reached by the sea surface after pertubations due to waves have been filtered out under average meteorological conditions and any combination of astronomical conditions.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D24 = Malin Ordnance Datum
entry.description: Mean sea level at Portmoor Pier, Malin Head averaged between 1960 and 1969 used for the elevation of the zero metres contour on Ordnance Survey of Ireland maps since 1970.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D19 = Normaal Amsterdams Peil
entry.description: Elevation marked by a brass benchmark in Amsterdam approximating to mean sea level at the Dutch Coast. Sometimes referred to as Normalnull and used as the zero metre contour in much of Western Europe..

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D20 = Ordnance Datum Newlyn
entry.description: Mean sea level at Newlyn in Cornwall averaged between 1915 and 1921 used for the elevation of the zero metres contour on UK Ordnance Survey maps.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D25 = Poolbeg Ordnance Datum
entry.description: Spring tide low water at Poolbeg Lighthouse, Dublin on 8 April 1837 used for the elevation of the zero metres contour on Ordnance Survey of Ireland maps before 1970.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D14 = Rijkswaterstaat mean sea level
entry.description: The mean sea level for a period of minimal 2 days converted to a many-year average based on measurements taken at the specified location.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D28 = Réseau Géodésique Français 80
entry.description: The vertical component of a French 3-D CRS computed in 1980 until superseded in 1993 approximating to mean sea level

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D29 = Réseau Géodésique Français 93
entry.description: The vertical component of a French 3-D CRS computed in 1993 approximating to mean sea level

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D31 = Spanish Chart Datum
entry.description: The elevation of the zero metres contour on the navigation charts produced by the Spanish Hydrographic Office for the Spanish coastal waters.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D26 = Swedish national coordinate system
entry.description: Swedish national benchmark network mean sea level datum.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D04 = UK Admiralty Chart Datum
entry.description: The elevation of the zero metres contour on the navigation charts produced for commercial marine navigation by the UK Hydrographic Office. It approximates to LAT.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D10 = ground level
entry.description: The level of the land surface at an unspecified location of interest. Usually associated with meteorological instruments tethered to the ground.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D99 = inapplicable
entry.description: There is no appropriate value. To be used in cases where metadata elements cannot be set null due to schema constraints e.g. when using a 3D CRS specification schema to describe 2D data.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D22 = local reference plane
entry.description: A local fixed elevation, usually codeled with a benchmark like a bolt, connected to a national datum through levelling.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D13 = mean high water
entry.description: The average of the highest elevation reached during at least two tidal cycles, but generally many more.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D18 = mean high water neaps
entry.description: The average throughout the year (when the average maximium declination of the moon is 23.5 degrees) of two successive high waters during those periods of 24 hours when the range of the tide is at its least.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D16 = mean high water springs
entry.description: The average throughout the year (when the average maximium declination of the moon is 23.5 degrees) of two successive high waters during those periods of 24 hours when the range of the tide is at its greatest.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D12 = mean low water
entry.description: The average of the lowest elevation reached during at least two tidal cycles, but generally many more.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D17 = mean low water neaps
entry.description: The average throughout the year (when the average maximium declination of the moon is 23.5 degrees) of two successive low waters during those periods of 24 hours when the range of the tide is at its least.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D15 = mean low water springs
entry.description: The average throughout the year (when the average maximium declination of the moon is 23.5 degrees) of two successive low waters during those periods of 24 hours when the range of the tide is at its greatest.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D11 = mean sea level
entry.description: The average elevation of the sea surface over an unspecified time period of at least a tidal cycle, but generally much longer.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D09 = sea floor
entry.description: The level of the sea floor at the location of interest. Usually associated with vertical position co-ordinates of oceanographic instruments tethered to the sea floor.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D08 = sea level
entry.description: The level of the sea surface at an unspecified time and location of interest. Usually associated with water depth measurements by shipboard echo sounder. May be anywhere between LAT and HAT.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:UKN = unknown
entry.description: The correct value is not known to, and not computable by, the creator of this information. However, a correct value probably exists.

entry.label: SDN:L111:7:D03 = unspecified chart datum
entry.description: The elevation of the zero metres contour on an unspecified marine navigation chart. These are generally based on LAT which represents the safest option for navigation.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:364 = 1000 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:364 = 1000 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 1000 Hz (sampling interval ranging from 2-0.5 msec) plus a multiple strings of towed hydrophones (streamers) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:363 = 1000 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:363 = 1000 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 1000 Hz (sampling interval ranging from 2-0.5 msec) plus a single string of towed hydrophones (streamer) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:365 = 2000 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:365 = 2000 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 2000 Hz (sampling interval ranging from 0.5-0.25 msec) plus a multiple strings of towed hydrophones (streamers) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:372 = 2000 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:372 = 2000 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 2000 Hz (sampling interval ranging from 0.5-0.25 msec) plus a single string of towed hydrophones (streamer) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:375 = 250 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:375 = 250 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 250 Hz (sampling interval ranging from 2-8 msec) plus a multiple strings of towed hydrophones (streamers) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:362 = 250 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:362 = 250 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 250 Hz (sampling interval ranging from 2-8 msec) plus a single string of towed hydrophones (streamer) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:374 = 60 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:374 = 60 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 60 Hz (sampling interval higher than 8 msec) plus a multiple strings of towed hydrophones (streamers) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:371 = 60 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:371 = 60 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to 60 Hz (sampling interval higher than 8 msec) plus a single string of towed hydrophones (streamer) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:366 = >2000 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:366 = >2000 Hz top-bandwidth multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to >2000 Hz (sampling interval lower than 0.25 msec) plus a multiple strings of towed hydrophones (streamers) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:373 = >2000 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:373 = >2000 Hz top-bandwidth single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source with a frequency up to >2000 Hz (sampling interval lower than 0.25 msec) plus a single string of towed hydrophones (streamer) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:367 = >2000 Hz top-bandwidth sub-bottom penetrator and mud profiler systems
entry.code: SDN:L054:12:367 = >2000 Hz top-bandwidth sub-bottom penetrator and mud profiler systems
entry.description: Devices that provide information on unconsolidated sediment structure through transmission and reception of an energy source with a frequency corresponding to a sampling interval lower than 0.25 msec.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:384 = ADVs and turbulence probes
entry.description: ADV is the acronym for acoustic doppler velocimeter. The group includes all in-situ instruments that make high frequency measurements of three-dimensional current velocity in order to determine the extent of turbulence within a water body.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:386 = Aerosol physical characterisers
entry.description: Instruments that determine physical attributes such as size and abundance of atmospheric aerosols.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:387 = Aethalometers
entry.description: Instruments that quantify atmospheric particulate carbon ('black carbon') concentrations.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:130 = CTD
entry.description: A package lowered and raised vertically from a surface platform, usually a ship, always carrying pressure, temperature and conductivity sensors. Addional optional sensors include fluorometers, transmissometers and radiometers. The package may also carry water bottles.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:131 = CTD undulators
entry.description: A package towed at varying depths by a ship, always carrying pressure, temperature and conductivity sensors. Addional optional sensors include fluorometers, transmissometers and radiometers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:183 = acoustic backscatter sensors
entry.description: Instrument that measures the amount of sound energy transmitted into the water column returned to the instrument.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:353 = active fluorometers
entry.description: Fluorometers that measure photosynthetic parameters by taking measurements whilst manipulating the phytoplankton with controlled high-intensity illumination such as pump and probe and FRRF

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:379 = altimiters
entry.description: Instruments that measure their distance above a specified elevation such as the sea surface or the seabed. Classification includes acoustic and pressure-based instruments that are designed to provide platform z co-ordinate spatial coverage in the atmosphere or a water body. It excludes remote sensing instruments such as LIDAR and satellite radar altimeters designed to map surface elevation.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:101 = anemometers
entry.description: Instrument that measures wind speed and direction at a single elevation

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:382 = atmospheric gas analysers
entry.description: In-situ instruments that can determine the proportion of one or more gaseous components of the atmosphere.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:132 = bathythermographs
entry.description: Instruments that measure vertical profiles of sea temperature by either lowering a pressure plus temperature senor package (MBT) or dropping a free falling disposable sensor (XBT).

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:358 = bubble detectors
entry.description: Instruments that measure the concentration and size of air bubbles in the water column.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:114 = current meters
entry.description: Instrument that measures current speed and direction at a single depth

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:115 = current profilers
entry.description: Instrument that measures current speed and direction at multiple predetermined depths simultaneously

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:351 = dissolved gas sensors
entry.description: Instrument that measures the concentration of gases, generally oxygen, dissolved in the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:EMSR = elecromagnetic sensors
entry.description: In-situ sensors that simultaneuously measure electrical and magnetic fields. They are usually moored on the seabed for long periods of time for determination of deep structure through monitoring magnetotelluric currents. However, some may also be configured to be receivers for active electromagnetic surveys such as CSEM.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:354 = expendable CTDs
entry.description: Instruments that measure vertical profiles of sea temperature and salinity with a free falling disposable temperature and conductivity sensor package.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:388 = flow meters
entry.description: Sensors that quantify the rate at which fluids (e.g. water or air) pass through sensor packages, instruments or sampling devices.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:113 = fluorometers
entry.description: Instrument that measures the amount of stimulated electromagnetic radiation produced by pulses of electromagnetic radiation emitted into the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:370 = geothermometers
entry.description: Instruments carrying a sensor that determines the temperature (degree of hotness) within geological units.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:158 = gravimeters
entry.description: Instrument that makes measurements of the Earth's gravity field

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:369 = hydrophones
entry.description: Devices containing transducers that convert underwater sound waves into electrical signals.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:112 = inverted echosounders
entry.description: Instruments that locate acoustic reflectors such as fronts in the water column by transmitting pulses of sound from the seabed and determing reflection return times

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:116 = lowered current profilers
entry.description: An acoustic doppler current meter lowered and raised vertically from a surface platform, typically a ship.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:159 = magnetometers
entry.description: Instrument that makes measurements of the Earth's magnetic field

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:383 = metal analysers
entry.description: In-situ instruments that can determine the total, dissolved or particulate concentration of one or more metallic elements (including trace metalloids like arsenic) in a water body.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:102 = meteorological packages
entry.description: Instrument that makes routine meteorological measurements on the atmosphere, typically air pressure, temperature and humidity

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:157 = multi-beam echosounders
entry.description: Instruments that measure water depth along several tracks parallel to the platform track by timing pulses of sound reflected on the seafloor

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:154 = multi-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source of unspecified frequency plus a multiple strings of towed hydrophones (streamers) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:181 = nutrient analysers
entry.description: Instrument that makes in-situ measurements of one or more of nitrate, nitrite, ammonium, urea, phosphate or silicate dissolved in the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:123 = optical backscatter sensors
entry.description: Instrument that measures the amount of electromagnetic radiation emitted into the water column returned to the instrument.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:355 = pH sensors
entry.description: Instruments that measure the hydrogen ion concentration in the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:150 = particle sizers
entry.description: An instrument that measures the size spectrum of particles suspended in the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:361 = penetrometers
entry.description: Dynamic or passive devices that determine the consistency or hardness of soil or sediment by measuring the depth or rate of penetration of a needle or cone rig into it when a known force is applied.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:360 = piezometers
entry.description: Devices that measure fluid (air, gas, water, or oil) pressure within soil, sediment, rock or concrete providing information such as water table level in an aquifer system.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:352 = plankton counters
entry.description: Instruments that categorise and count plankton in the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:385 = platform attitude sensors
entry.description: Instruments that measure platform orientation or rates of platform motion or acceleration in any direction or along any axis. Excludes inertial navigation systems that are designed to determine platform location with respect to an external co-ordinate reference system.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:359 = plummets
entry.description: Devices comprising a weight attached to the end of a graduated rope used to measure point water depths.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:381 = precipitation gauges
entry.description: Instruments that measure either the rate of fall or integrated amount of rain, snow, sleet, hail or graupel.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:122 = radiometers
entry.description: Instrument that measures the intensity of electromagnetic radiation in either the atmosphere or the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:103 = radiosondes
entry.description: A balloon-borne package equipped with a radio transmitter and meteorological sensors typically measuring temperature, pressure, and humidity.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:356 = redox potential sensors
entry.description: Instruments that measure the tendency of the water column to either gain or lose electrons when it is subject to change by introduction of a new species

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:350 = salinity sensor
entry.description: Instrument that simultaneously measures electrical conductivity and temperature in the water column to provide temperature and salinity data

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:111 = sea level recorders
entry.description: Instrument that make smoothed measuremeants of the elevation of the sea surface relative to a fixed vertical datum

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:378 = sediment profile imagers
entry.description: Devices that provide in-situ still or video images of a section including bottom water, the undisturbed sediment-water interface and the upper sediment layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:376 = sediment surface markers
entry.description: Physical markers that allow changes in the position of the boundary between sediment and air or water by visible comparison against marked graduations in units of measurement of dimension length.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:155 = seismic refraction systems
entry.description: A network of seismometers or geophones plus an energy source that determine geologic structure by detecting waves refracted by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:368 = seismometers
entry.description: Devices placed on the ground or seabed to measure physical movement of that substrate.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:152 = sidescan sonars
entry.description: Instruments with directional acoustic transmitters and receivers fitted to an underwater platform that emit fan-shaped pulses down toward the seafloor across a wide angle perpendicular to the path of the platform through the water.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:156 = single-beam echosounders
entry.description: Instruments that measure water depth at a single point below the platform by timing pulses of sound reflected on the seafloor

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:153 = single-channel seismic reflection systems
entry.description: An energy source of unspecified frequency plus a single string of towed hydrophones (streamer) that determine geologic structure by detecting waves reflected by subsurface layers.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:185 = sound velocity sensors
entry.description: Instrument that measures the velocity of sound in seawater

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:380 = submarine cables
entry.description: Electrical conductors routed beneath the sea and connecting land stations. Oceanographic interest focuses on changes in electrical resistance that may be related to the magnitude of Lagrangian currents.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:135 = thermistor chains
entry.description: A group of rigidly-mounted temperature sensors sampled by a common data logger held at various depths in the water column.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:133 = thermosalinographs
entry.description: Temperature and conductivity sensors mounted on a sea-surface platform continuously measuring a surface water supply.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:124 = transmissometers
entry.description: Systems that measure the attenuation of electromagnetic radiation by the water column. Includes human observer plus Secchi Disk.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:184 = turbulence energy dissipation sensors
entry.description: Instrument that makes high frequency measurements of kinetic energy in the water column

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:180 = underwater cameras
entry.description: All types of photographic equipment that may be deployed underwater including stills, video, film and digital systems

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:377 = water level markers
entry.description: Fixed physical markers that allow changes in the position of the boundary between a water body and the atmosphere by visible comparison against marked graduations in units of measurement of dimension length.

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:134 = water temperature sensor
entry.description: An instrument that measures the temperature of the water with which it is in contact

entry.label: SDN:L054:12:110 = wave recorders
entry.description: Instrument that measures water column surface wave parameters including height, period, direction and energy spectra.

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS16 = Argos GPS-localised transmitters
entry.description: <mode>GPS localisation²</mode><accuracy>better than 100m</accuracy>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS17 = Argos doppler-localised transmitters
entry.description: <mode>Doppler-derived Argos localisation</mode><accuracy>better than 250m (class 3) to worse than 1500m (class 0)</accuracy>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS10 = Automatic Ranging Grid Overlay DM 54 receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS10 = Automatic Ranging Grid Overlay DM 54 receivers
entry.description: <frequency>1.6-2MHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode><range>450km</range><accuracy>4-7m down to 20m at maximum range</accuracy><operational>from 1977 (mid-80s in Europe)</operational><notes>Survey positioning system.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS08 = Decca Navigator System HiFix receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS08 = Decca Navigator System HiFix receivers
entry.description: <frequency>1.6MHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode><range>under 100km</range><accuracy>better than 10m: maximum accuracy at 50km range is 1.5m</accuracy><operating>1962 to 2000</operating><notes>Not for general navigation. Chains usually set up for specific surveys.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS01 = Decca Navigator System main chain receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS01 = Decca Navigator System main chain receivers
entry.description: <frequency>70 and 130kHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode><range>450km (day) to 750km (night)</range><accuracy>50m(day) to 200m (night) in good conditions down to 2km near range limit</accuracy><operating>WWII to 2001-03 (2000-03-31 in UK)</operating><notes> Transmitter groups, each with a master and three slaves</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS04 = Differential Global Positioning System receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS04 = Differential Global Positioning System receivers
entry.description: <accuracy>better than 100m to better than 10m</accuracy><notes>GPS augmented by a network of fixed ground stations that continuously broadcast the difference between their true locations and the location determined from the satellites.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS02 = Global Navigation Satellite System receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS02 = Global Navigation Satellite System receivers
entry.description: <notes>Based on a network of satellites deployed by the former Soviet Union. The network was initiated in 1976 but fell into disrepair before full global coverage was reached during the political upheaval of the early 90s</notes>.

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS21 = Hyperfix receivers
entry.description: <frequency>1.6-3.4MHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic (usual), circular or combined</mode><range>250km (night) to 700km (day)</range><accuracy>up to 0.5-1m</accuracy><operating>until 2000</operating><notes>Racal positioning system similar to Decca HiFix based on temporary or permanent transmitter chains comprising a master plus at least two slaves.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS05 = Long Range Navigation version C receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS05 = Long Range Navigation version C receivers
entry.description: <frequency>70-130kHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode><range>950kmto 1700km (day): 650km to 1250km (day)</range><operational>1947 to 2010. Maintained as GPS backup in the EU.<notes>Global navigation based on transmitters in several European countries, Japan, Canada (until 2002-10) and USA (until 2010-02-08).<notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS06 = Marine chronometers
entry.description: <notes>Timepieces of sufficient precision to allow their use of portable time standards.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS20 = Motorola Mini-Ranger receivers
entry.description: <frequency>5410-5890MHz<range>up to 75km</range><accuracy>up to 2m</accuracy><notes>A family of short-wave receivers that determine position by determining the line-of-sight distance from 3 or more transmitters set up for the survey..</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS03 = NAVSTAR Global Positioning System receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS03 = NAVSTAR Global Positioning System receivers
entry.description: <accuracy>better than 100m</accuracy><notes>Global navigation based on a network of satellites deployed and maintained by the USA.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS18 = Navy Navigation Satellite System receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS18 = Navy Navigation Satellite System receivers
entry.description: <mode>Doppler-derived localisation</mode><accuracy>better than 10km or 2km if combined with relative water velocity em-log</accuracy>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS15 = Omega receivers
entry.description: <frequency>10-14kHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode><range>up to 15000km</range><accuracy>better than 7.4km</accuracy><operational>1968-1997</operational><notes>Global long-range but low accuracy navigation system</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS14 = Pulse8 receivers
entry.description: <frequency>100kHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode><range>250km to 750km</range><accuracy>30m to 500m</accuracy><operational>1970s to late 1990s</operational>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS13 = Rana receivers
entry.description: <frequency>around 300-400kHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS07 = Sextants
entry.description: <notes>Optical instruments that accurately measure the angle between pairs of visible celestial bodies such as the sun, moon or stars. </notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS12 = Système leger de measure de distance receivers
entry.code: SDN:L056:3:POS12 = Système leger de measure de distance receivers
entry.description: <frequency>420-450MHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic or circular</mode><range>400km hyperbolic; 75-100km circular</range><accuracy>better than 2m below horizon (10m above horizon)</accuracy><operational>1980s to 1995</operational><notes>Navigation and positioning system for the North Sea petroleum industry.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS09 = Toran receivers
entry.description: <frequency>around 2MHz</frequency><mode>hyperbolic</mode><range>150-200km</range><accuracy>better than 20m</accuracy><notes>Mostly used for aircraft.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS11 = Trident receivers
entry.description: <frequency>420-450MHz</frequency><mode>circular</mode><range>150km</range><accuracy>better than 3m</accuracy><notes>Survey positioning system.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS22 = Trisponder navigation systems
entry.description: <range>80km</range><accuracy>1m (resolution 0.1m)</accuracy><notes>Family of microwave short-range positioning systems with vessel equipment and three shore transponders (master and two slaves) set up specifically for surveys.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:357 = acoustic tracking systems
entry.description: A network of acoustic sensors that determine the location of a sound source by triangulation such as acoustically active float tracking systems.

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS24 = dead reckoning
entry.description: <notes>The process of estimating current position based upon a previously determined position, or fix, and advancing that position based upon known or estimated speeds over elapsed time, and course.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS19 = inertial navigation systems
entry.description: <notes>Systems that determine spatial position using high-accuracy inertial measurements plus input from other sensors such as doppler current sensors to determine platform 3-D location by interpolation between satellite network fixes.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:L056:3:POS23 = radio tracking systems
entry.description: <notes>Directional radio receivers that determine the location of a mobile radio transmitter (such as a bird or animal tag) by triangulation.</notes>

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ASAM = Acoustic backscatter in the water column = SDN:P021:68:ASAM = Acoustic backscatter in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:ASAM = Acoustic backscatter in the water column = SDN:P021:68:ASAM = Acoustic backscatter in the water column
entry.description: Includes all parameters covering the strength of acoustic signal return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:NOYS = Acoustic noise in the water column = SDN:P021:68:NOYS = Acoustic noise in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:NOYS = Acoustic noise in the water column = SDN:P021:68:NOYS = Acoustic noise in the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ACSR = Active seismic refraction
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the magnitude of earth movements resulting from artificial sources (such as explosions) far away from the measurement site.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CAPH = Air pressure
entry.description: Measurements of air pressure as the dependent variable (ie excluding air pressure measured to specify the z co-ordinate of a balloon or sonde), including derived parameters such as tendency (rate of change) and related parameters such as air density.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CDTA = Air temperature
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the degree of hotness of the atmosphere. Specifically excludes indirect measurements of other parameters such as wet bulb temperatures.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ALKY = Alkalinity, acidity and pH of the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:ALKY = Alkalinity, acidity and pH of the water column
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the hydrogen ion concentration in water bodies

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:HAAC = Amino acids in sediment
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in unlithified seabed material.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AMON = Ammonium concentration parameters in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:AMON = Ammonium concentration parameters in the water column
entry.description: Ammonium concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ATDP = Atmospheric deposition rates
entry.description: Fluxes of chemical species from the atmosphere to sea or land surface including precipitation and aerosol deposition but excluding fluxes due to exchange of gases

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ATEM = Atmospheric emissions
entry.description: Parameters quantifying and describing the release of substances into the atmosphere as a result of human activity

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CHUM = Atmospheric humidity
entry.description: Parameters that either quantify the water content of moist air or are specifically used in its determination (eg wet bulb air temperature)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ATPC = Atmospheric particulates
entry.description: Parameters quantifying and categorising the particulate phases (solids and aerosols) of the atmosphere, excluding chemical composition

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ATVS = Atmospheric visibility and transparency
entry.description: Parameters relating to atmospheric clarity, such as optical transmittance/attenuance, and resultant visibility

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BNUC = Bacteria generic abundance in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BNUC = Bacteria generic abundance in sediment
entry.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any soil or sediment.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BNTX = Bacteria generic abundance in water bodies
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BNTX = Bacteria generic abundance in water bodies
entry.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any body of fresh or salt water.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BABI = Bacteria in biota
entry.description: Parameters relating to the abundance and nature of bacteria (Kingdom Monera) infecting other biota.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CBCC = Bacteria morphology and physiology
entry.description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity of bacteria, defined as Kingdom Monera (includes cyanobacteria). Includes parameters both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BNTC = Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BNTC = Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
entry.description: Basically any bacteria carbon biomass parameters that aren't included in parameter group BATC because they cannot be mapped to specific taxa in the ITIS taxonomy. Bacteria are defined as Kingdom Monera, which includes cyanobacteria.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BPBP = Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BPBP = Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BAUC = Bacteria taxonomic abundance in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BAUC = Bacteria taxonomic abundance in sediment
entry.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any soil or sediment.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BATX = Bacteria taxonomic abundance in water bodies
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BATX = Bacteria taxonomic abundance in water bodies
entry.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BDWC = Bacteria taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BDWC = Bacteria taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment
entry.description: Bacteria ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. The taxa may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BATC = Bacteria taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BATC = Bacteria taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
entry.description: Bacteria carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TBGZ = Bacterial consumption in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TBGZ = Bacterial consumption in the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:UPTH = Bacterial production in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:UPTH = Bacterial production in the water column
entry.description: Parameters related to bacterial production determination by measurement of dissolved organic molecule (e.g. leucine, thymidine) uptake rates

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:MBAN = Bathymetry and Elevation
entry.description: Depth of the water column or elevation of land surface relative to sea surface, geoid or other datum

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP010 = Bioassay and contaminant biological impact
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:GP010 = Bioassay and contaminant biological impact
entry.description: Parameters describing the effects of substances on living organisms.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BDRV = Biodiversity indices
entry.description: Parameters describing the variety of entity types encountered in a population of living organisms

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:EXUV = Biological detritus in the water column suspended particulate material
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:EXUV = Biological detritus in the water column suspended particulate material
entry.description: Parameters quantifying and categorising biological detritus (eg exuvia and faecal pellets) in the water column that have been derived from the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BLUM = Bioluminescence parameters
entry.description: Parameters describing the nature and intensity of light generated by biological activity in the water column.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP088 = Bird behaviour
entry.description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of birds (Class Aves), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP004 = Bird reproduction
entry.description: Parameters related to the reproduction of birds (Class Aves)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BRDD = Bird taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of surface
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BRDD = Bird taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of surface
entry.description: Bird (Class Aves) abundance per unit area (of land or sea) presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy.These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BRDA = Bird taxonomy-related counts
entry.description: Bird (Class Aves) count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CBSD = Carbon concentrations in sediment
entry.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of sediment. Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CBSP = Carbon concentrations in suspended particulate material
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CBSP = Carbon concentrations in suspended particulate material
entry.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ACO2 = Carbon monoxide and dioxide concentrations in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:ACO2 = Carbon monoxide and dioxide concentrations in the atmosphere
entry.description: CO and CO2 concentration parameters in any phase of the atmosphere (but usuall the gaseous phase). Includes pCO2.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CARS = Carotenoid pigment concentrations in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CARS = Carotenoid pigment concentrations in sediment
entry.description: Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CARO = Carotenoid pigment concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CARO = Carotenoid pigment concentrations in the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CETA = Cetacean abundance
entry.description: Parameters that specify the number of specified members of Order Cetacea present at a particular time and location, including presence/absence indicators.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CEBH = Cetacean behaviour
entry.description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of cetaceans (Order Cetacea), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CEMP = Cetacean morphology and physiology
entry.description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CEMO = Cetacean mortality
entry.description: Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality in cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP018 = Cetacean reproduction
entry.description: Parameters related to the reproduction of cetaceans (Order Cetacea)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FR11 = Chlorofluorocarbon concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FR11 = Chlorofluorocarbon concentrations in the water column
entry.description: Concentrations of chlorofluorocarbons (also known as freons or CFCs) in sny body of water

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CPSD = Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CPSD = Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in sediment
entry.description: Includes all variants of chlorophyll. Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CPWC = Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CPWC = Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in the water column
entry.description: Includes all variants of chlorophyll expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column. Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CHEX = Cloud cover height and extent
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CHEX = Cloud cover height and extent
entry.description: Parameters describing the horizontal and vertical extent of cloud cover

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CLTY = Cloud type
entry.description: Parameters that classify cloud cover into types such as cumulus and cirrus.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:COGE = Coastal geomorphology
entry.description: All parameters associated with coastal landforms such as beaches and dunes including morphology, evolution and associated transport phenomena

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:MTWC = Colloidal metal concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:MTWC = Colloidal metal concentrations in the water column
entry.description: Concentrations of metal elements in the colloidal phase of the water column. Usually the dissolved concentration difference between conventionally filtered water and ultra-filtered water.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:COCC = Colloidal organic carbon concentration in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:COCC = Colloidal organic carbon concentration in the water column
entry.description: Colloidal organic carbon per unit volume of the water column.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ATPX = Concentration of adenlylates in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:ATPX = Concentration of adenlylates in the water column
entry.description: Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) in all phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TADN = Concentration of adenylates in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TADN = Concentration of adenylates in sediment
entry.description: Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AAWC = Concentration of alkanamines (amines) in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:AAWC = Concentration of alkanamines (amines) in the water column
entry.description: Alkanamine concentrations in all phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SALK = Concentration of alkanes in sediment samples
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SALK = Concentration of alkanes in sediment samples
entry.description: Alkane concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AALK = Concentration of alkanes in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:AALK = Concentration of alkanes in the atmosphere
entry.description: Alkane concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:DALK = Concentration of alkanes in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:DALK = Concentration of alkanes in the water column
entry.description: Alkane concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column. Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AEYN = Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:AEYN = Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the atmosphere
entry.description: Alkene and alkyne concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AQYN = Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:AQYN = Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the water column
entry.description: Alkene and alkyne concentrations in all phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CAKN = Concentration of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CAKN = Concentration of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column
entry.description: Concentrations of alkenones and alkenoates in all phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TOCH = Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and ketones in water bodies
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TOCH = Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and ketones in water bodies
entry.description: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and ketones in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CASD = Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers, aldehydes and ketones in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CASD = Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers, aldehydes and ketones in sediment
entry.description: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers,aldehydes and ketones in unlithified sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff).

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:HMSB = Concentration of dissolved organic matter in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:HMSB = Concentration of dissolved organic matter in the water column
entry.description: Concentration (not 380nm light absorption) parameters for dissolved organic matter (includes humics, yellow matter, Gelbstoff) in the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CLXX = Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment pore waters
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CLXX = Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment pore waters
entry.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of sediment pore water

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:HLAT = Concentration of inorganic halogens in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:HLAT = Concentration of inorganic halogens in the atmosphere
entry.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of the atmosphere.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:HLWC = Concentration of inorganic halogens in water bodies
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:HLWC = Concentration of inorganic halogens in water bodies
entry.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TRIS = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TRIS = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment
entry.description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in sediment (anything collected by a corer including fluff)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SPHT = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment pore water
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SPHT = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment pore water
entry.description: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of sediment pore waters

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SXCN = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SXCN = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material
entry.description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material (anything collected by filtration or sediment trapping). Group does not include parameters expressing data per unit volume of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SPWC = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SPWC = Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in the water column
entry.description: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:LIBI = Concentration of lipids in biota
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:LIBI = Concentration of lipids in biota
entry.description: Concentrations (ie quantity per unit mass or volume, but not relative abundance profiles) of lipids in any type of biological sample

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AAMN = Concentration of nitrogen species in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:AAMN = Concentration of nitrogen species in the atmosphere
entry.description: Concentrations of both organic (eg amines) and inorganic (eg ammonia and oxides of nitrogen) nitrogen species in all phases of the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SDNA = Concentration of nucleic acids in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SDNA = Concentration of nucleic acids in sediment
entry.description: Concentrations of nucleic acids (DNA, RNA etc.) per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:WDNA = Concentration of nucleic acids in water bodies
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:WDNA = Concentration of nucleic acids in water bodies
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of cell nucleus material (RNA, DNA, gene copies) in any body of salt or fresh water.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:STOM = Concentration of organic matter in sediments
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:STOM = Concentration of organic matter in sediments
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the proportion of organic material in a soil or sediment sample

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AORG = Concentration of organic matter in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:AORG = Concentration of organic matter in the atmosphere
entry.description: Parameters quantifying uncategorised organic substance concentrations in atmospheric, generally aerosol, samples such as organic matter and DOC.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:OHAT = Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:OHAT = Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the atmosphere
entry.description: 'Other' (not alkanes, alkenes, alkynes or PAHs) hydrocarbon concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the atmosphere.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:OHWC = Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:OHWC = Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the water column
entry.description: 'Other' (not alkanes, alkenes, alkynes or PAHs) hydrocarbon concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column. Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in biota
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in biota
entry.description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in either whole organisms or their constituent parts that are not included in other categories

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in sediment samples
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in sediment samples
entry.description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff' that are not included in other specific categories

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:PCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in suspended particulate material
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:PCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in suspended particulate material
entry.description: 'Other' organic contaminant (substances regarded as harmful other than PCBs and PAHs) concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc. This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:OCAA = Concentration of other organic contaminants in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:OCAA = Concentration of other organic contaminants in the atmosphere
entry.description: Parameters quantifying concentrations of organic contaminants (substances regarded as harmful) other than PCBs and PAHs in all phases of the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:WCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:WCOC = Concentration of other organic contaminants in the water column
entry.description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water that are not included in other specific categories

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BCOS = Concentration of other substances in biota
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BCOS = Concentration of other substances in biota
entry.description: 'Other' (than metals or organic contaminants) substance concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts. This is a 'bucket' grouping that may be reclassified as the dictionary developes.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:PTOX = Concentration of phycotoxins in biota
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:PTOX = Concentration of phycotoxins in biota
entry.description: Parameters associated with the concentration of algae-generated toxins in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BCPB = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in biota
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BCPB = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in biota
entry.description: PCB concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SPCB = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in sediment samples
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SPCB = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in sediment samples
entry.description: PCB concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:PPCB = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in suspended particulate material
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:PPCB = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in suspended particulate material
entry.description: PCB concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc. This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP048 = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:GP048 = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the atmosphere
entry.description: Parameters quantifying polychlorobiphenyl (PCB) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:PPWC = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:PPWC = Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the water column
entry.description: PCB concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group excludes SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight).

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:BCAH = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in biota
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:BCAH = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in biota
entry.description: PAH concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SCAH = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in sediment samples
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SCAH = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in sediment samples
entry.description: PAH concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:PCAH = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in suspended particulate material
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:PCAH = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in suspended particulate material
entry.description: PAH concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc. This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP050 = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:GP050 = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the atmosphere
entry.description: Parameters quantifying polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:PCHW = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:PCHW = Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the water column
entry.description: PAH concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group includes concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase, but not concentrations per unit wieght of SPM.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SPRO = Concentration of proteins in sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SPRO = Concentration of proteins in sediment
entry.description: Concentrations of proteins per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:WPRO = Concentration of proteins in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:WPRO = Concentration of proteins in the water column
entry.description: Concentrations of proteins in all phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:OPCN = Concentration of silicon species in suspended particulate material
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:OPCN = Concentration of silicon species in suspended particulate material
entry.description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in SPM (material gathered by filtration or sediment trapping). Only includes parameters expressed per unit mass of SPM and not per unit volume of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SIXX = Concentration of silicon species in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SIXX = Concentration of silicon species in the water column
entry.description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in all phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TSED = Concentration of suspended particulate material in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TSED = Concentration of suspended particulate material in the water column
entry.description: Parameters quantifying SPM concentration in the water column by weight, by volume or in terms of turbidity

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CXAA = Concentrations of carboxylic acids and carboxylates in the atmosphere
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CXAA = Concentrations of carboxylic acids and carboxylates in the atmosphere
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the concentration of acids containing a carboxyl (-C(=O)OH) group, their anions or their salts in any phase of the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CFTM = Contaminant fluxes between the terrestrial and marine environment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CFTM = Contaminant fluxes between the terrestrial and marine environment
entry.description: Parameters quanitifying the transfer of substances considered harmful from land to sea, including river discharge rates of contaminant species (but not freshwater discharge rates).

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:AYMD = Date and time
entry.description: All date and time parameters

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SIGT = Density of the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SIGT = Density of the water column
entry.description: Absolute determinations of water column density plus parameters (generally expressed as density anomaly) derived from temperature and salinity

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:DPEV = Depositional environment
entry.description: Parameters characterising the environment in which sediments were deposited either by observation or interpretation of sedimentary rocks and unlithified sediments.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:D000 = Diatom taxonomy-related abundance per unit mass of sediment
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:D000 = Diatom taxonomy-related abundance per unit mass of sediment
entry.description: Determinations of the abundance of diatom remains in sediment linked to taxonomic identifications that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TFAA = Dissolved amino acid concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TFAA = Dissolved amino acid concentrations in the water column
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group dissolved in a body of water.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:OGPW = Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in sediment pore waters
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:OGPW = Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in sediment pore waters
entry.description: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in sediment pore water samples

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:SCOX = Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:SCOX = Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in the water column
entry.description: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TNRP = Dissolved inorganic carbon production and respiration in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TNRP = Dissolved inorganic carbon production and respiration in the water column
entry.description: Parameters related to the rates of TCO2 production and consumption based on light/dark bottle incubations

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TDIN = Dissolved inorganic nitrogen concentration in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TDIN = Dissolved inorganic nitrogen concentration in the water column
entry.description: Total concentration of all dissolved inorganic nitrogen species in the water column, usually derived by summation of individual nutrient concentrations (NO3+NO2+NH4). Some workers may also include urea.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:MTWD = Dissolved metal concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:MTWD = Dissolved metal concentrations in the water column
entry.description: Concentrations of metal elements in the dissolved phase of the water column. This may include a contribution from the particulate phase if this has not been totally removed by filtration and the metal in question is reactive (ie detected as if it were dissolved) to the analytical technique used.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:HEXC = Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:HEXC = Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column
entry.description: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:DOCC = Dissolved organic carbon concentration in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:DOCC = Dissolved organic carbon concentration in the water column
entry.description: DOC per unit volume of the water column. Note that this includes some parameters that are strictly defined as total carbon, because the water was unfiltered on the assumption that POC was negligible.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:OCPW = Dissolved organic carbon concentrations in sediment pore waters
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:OCPW = Dissolved organic carbon concentrations in sediment pore waters
entry.description: Concentrations of dissolved organic carbon in sediment pore waters

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:DOCU = Dissolved organic carbon uptake and production in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:DOCU = Dissolved organic carbon uptake and production in the water column
entry.description: Any parameter relating to the rate of DOC concentration change in the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:DGPW = Dissolved oxygen concentration parameters in sediment pore waters
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:DGPW = Dissolved oxygen concentration parameters in sediment pore waters
entry.description: All concentration parameters (including saturation) for dissolved oxygen in sediment pore waters

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:DOXY = Dissolved oxygen parameters in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:DOXY = Dissolved oxygen parameters in the water column
entry.description: All dissolved oxygen parameters (including saturation and utilisation) for the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TDNT = Dissolved total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TDNT = Dissolved total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column
entry.description: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved nitrogen per unit volume of the water column. Grouped together as organic nitrogen frequently determined as total nitrogen.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:TDPX = Dissolved total or organic phosphorus concentration in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:TDPX = Dissolved total or organic phosphorus concentration in the water column
entry.description: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved phosphorus per unit volume of the water column. Grouped together as organic phosphorus frequently determined as total phosphorus.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:MDWD = Dissolved trace metalloid concentrations in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:MDWD = Dissolved trace metalloid concentrations in the water column
entry.description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements in the dissolved phase of the water column. This may include a contribution from the particulate phase if this has not been totally removed by filtration and the metal in question is reactive (ie detected as if it were dissolved) to the analytical technique used. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:DSCO = Distribution coefficients in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:DSCO = Distribution coefficients in the water column
entry.description: Distribution coefficients of species between the dissolved and particulate phases of the water column

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:CNDC = Electrical conductivity of the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:CNDC = Electrical conductivity of the water column
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:ENGP = Engineering parameters
entry.description: Technical parameters that provide information on how well an instrument or data acquisition system is working

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:EXCR = Excretion rate parameters in the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:EXCR = Excretion rate parameters in the water column
entry.description: Includes all parameters relating to all mechanisms of waste release except respiration.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FABD = Fauna abundance per unit area of the bed
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FABD = Fauna abundance per unit area of the bed
entry.description: Any fauna (class Animalia) abundance per unit are of sea, river or lake bed. Broad group overlapping a number of more specific groups that should be used preferentially, but this group is provided as an alternative to one-to-many mappings.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:RSIS = Field resistivity, electromagnetics and polarisation
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:RSIS = Field resistivity, electromagnetics and polarisation
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the electrical properties of geological units in the field. Includes parameters used to determine resistivity structure for shallow sediment properties, porosities and presence of hydrocarbon (CSEM), deeper crust and mantle studies (Magnetotellurics) and ore body location (polarisation).

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FATX = Fish abundance in water bodies
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FATX = Fish abundance in water bodies
entry.description: Paramaters that quantify the numbers of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) at a given location in any body of salt or fresh water.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FCST = Fish and shellfish catch statistics
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FCST = Fish and shellfish catch statistics
entry.description: Parameters quantifying and describing biota take by fishing activities

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP085 = Fish behaviour
entry.description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FIBM = Fish biomass in water bodies
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FIBM = Fish biomass in water bodies
entry.description: Parameters quantifying the mass of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes)in total or by species per unit area or per unit volume in any body of fresh or salt water expressed in any form (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen, etc.).

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:GP005 = Fish disease and parasites
entry.description: Parameters related to the infection of Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) by parasites and disease. Includes visual assesements and analytical data.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FATM = Fish morphology, age and physiology
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FATM = Fish morphology, age and physiology
entry.description: Paramaters that quantify the size, shape, age and life processes (including mortality) of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes).

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FNTX = Fish non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FNTX = Fish non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
entry.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) abundance per unit volume parameters not included under FATX. Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FNTM = Fish non taxonomy-related morphology
entry.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) size and shape parameters not included under FATM. Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FREP = Fish reproduction
entry.description: Paramaters that quantify the fecundity, reproductive rates or nature of reproduction in fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes).

entry.label: SDN:P021:68:FBAB = Fish taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed
entry.code: SDN:P021:68:FBAB = Fish taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed
entry.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes) abundance per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.
